subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Religion and Gender: Who Gets to Lead?
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Religion and Gender: Who Gets to Lead?.

hook.text: Women can't be Catholic priests but can be Anglican bishops. Same God, different rules. Gender is a battleground.

buildup.text: Most traditional religions restrict women's roles. Texts written by men in patriarchal societies reflect those values.

discovery.text: Feminist theology rereads scripture to uncover hidden female voices. Mary Magdalene was a leader, not just a follower.

twist.text: Some of the fastest-growing churches in Africa and Asia are led by women. The global south rewrites gender roles.

climax.text: Religion both oppresses and empowers women. The text hasn't changed. The readers have. Interpretation is key.

punchline.text: Same scripture, different rules for women. Who reads the text decides who leads.

quiz.question: How is gender addressed differently across religions?
options: All religions treat gender the same
Different traditions interpret the same texts to allow or restrict women's leadership
